column4: hello. I'm trying to install Ubuntu 10.04 in my laptop, but I'm stuck with my ethernet controller (SIS191 gigabit), that doesn't work (it even notice that there's an network avaiable). Please help me!
is that what is output in: sudo lshw -C network
for checking this, I should be connect to any network?
not necessary. The command merely scans the hardware
http://www.howtoforge.com/creating-the-sis191-gigabit-ethernet-driver-on-linux-2.6
oh, looks complicated. But thanks, I'll do my best.
you'll need to do it everytime you get a new kernel too so keep the source handy
+1 their video cards are fun to setup too and need xorg.conf files
yeah, I have a SIS671 too. It was a pain to work in better resolution.
if you check the hcl before purchasing it makes life easier
yeah, but as I said before, it was a present (from my mother) and she knows shit about hardware.
ooh, waait. I dunno if that howto you sent me will work. I don't get any error when execute 'modprobe sis190'
oooh exciting. Try: ifconfig
dunno if you saw the last message but: what should I search on ifconfig's output?
if you have a new interface name
indeed
well, it always been there, so nothing changed...
ok then try: sudo dhclient eth0
now I need internet connection, right?
i'd also run: dmesg | tail ,to check the kernel messages
did the lights on the interface flash?
what do you mean?
